Museum Reviews

Read my personal reviews of 13 museums

Metropolitan Museum of Art

üìç New York, NY 10028

"This is a must for any fine art lover! If you want to see it all...You will need 8 hours minimum! The Met does not dissapoint anyone from contemporary lovers to the wannabe egyptoligist. My personal favorite is the portrain of Madame X, by Sargent. I jumped for joy when I saw here for the first time that everyone in the gallery stared at me (how emabarrasing!). The layout of every single gallery is filled to the brim but still feels spacious and not overwhelming. The european wing was closed when I went, but its just another reason for me to go back again. HOT TIP: The Costumes and Textiles gallery is an extra ticket."

Visit Website

American Museum of Natural History

üìç New York, NY 10024

"Its difficult for me to pick just one things I love about the ANHM because I loved so much of it. The exhibits make a brilliant effort to be interactive and immersive. The hall of minerals was spellbinding, and I particularly loved the use of augmented reality in that exhibit. The live insect section is mezmorizing I would have stayed for ours watching the ants and other animals if my friends were not there. The downside? There are not enough chairs or benches, and its constistently rowded and loud. If you are willing to brave the chaos... you can sit with Teaddy Roselvelt's statue near the exit!"

Visit Website

Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)

üìç New York, NY 10019

"Exceptional contemporary art collection. The renovation modernized the spaces beautifully. Don't miss the photography section."

Guggenheim Museum

üìç New York, NY 10128

"The spiral architecture is as much an art piece as the collections inside. Did you know Beyonce had advertised her album Cowboy Carter on the facade, even though she never go permission to do so?"

Whitney Museum of American Art

üìç New York, NY 10014

"I personally liked the Whitney more than the MOMA.Cutting-edge American art in a beautiful waterfront location. The outdoor terrace offers great views!"

Museum of Jewish Heritage

üìç New York, NY 10280

"A poignant and educational experience with powerful exhibits. You have to be strong and ready for some difficult material in this museum. But some exhibits have warnings, or other specific sheidling for children to help visitors who may be sensitive to certain topics. I enjoyed learning more about living holocoust survivors and their stories."

Visit Website

Childrens Museum of Manhattan

üìç New York, NY 10024

"Hey! I used to work at a childrens museum, and I can tell you that adults find them fun too! Perfect for young children with hands-on, interactive exhibits. Great way to inspire curiosity and creativity in kids and their families."

Brooklyn Museum

üìç Brooklyn, NY 11238

"Impressive collection of world art and American works. The Egyptian collection is outstanding and the building itself is architecturally beautiful. If you want good egyptian articats without the crowds at the Met, this is worth the subways ride."

Visit Website

The Frick Collection

üìç New York, NY 10021

"A hidden gem among NYC museums! Intimate collection of masterpieces with an elegant mansion setting. Cannot reccomend this enough for those who want the fine art fix, without waiting in line for 45 minutes."

Visit Website

Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum

üìç New York, NY 10036

"I did not get to visit this one during my trip personally, but my friends have many times. Fascinating museum housed on an actual aircraft carrier. Great for those interested in military history, aviation, and space."

Visit Website

The Morgan Library & Museum

üìç New York, NY 10016

"Literary lovers rejoice. An exceptional collection of rare books, manuscripts, and art. The library itself is a masterpiece with a magical reading room that will transport you into your favorite lord of the rings book."

"NYC has been around for so long. I iddint know much about it being from Masachusetts. This museum is perfect for understanding NYC's rich history from colonial times to present. Great exhibits and knowledgeable staff."
